title-group.article-title: Conditioning in Markov Chain Monte Carlo

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1995 American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

abstract.p: The so-called "Rao-Blackwellized" estimators proposed by Gelfand and Smith do not always reduce variance in Markov chain Monte Carlo when the dependence in the Markov chain is taken into account. An illustrative example is given, and a theorem characterizing the necessary and sufficient condition for such an estimator to always reduce variance is proved.
